description:
Spatial Computational Thinking is increasingly being
recognised as a fundamental method for various spatial
disciplines. It involves idea formulation, algorithm
development, solution exploration, with a focus on the
manipulation of geometric and semantic datasets.
Students will use parametric modelling tools for generating
and analysing building elements at varying scales. Such
tools use visual programming interfaces to allow complex
algorithms to be developed and tested. Students will learn
how to structure their ideas as algorithmic procedures that
integrate data-structures, functions, and control flow.
Through this process, students will also become familiar
with higher-level computational concepts, such as
decomposition, encapsulation and abstraction.
title: Spatial Computational Thinking
